Wikipedia contains 5,725,987 pages.
There are a total of 447,075,827 links between Wikipedia pages.
8,414,709 Wikipedia pages are actually just redirects to other pages.
"List of current U.S. state legislators" is the Wikipedia page with the highest number of outgoing links (9,915).
"List of people from Illinois" is the Wikipedia page with the second highest number of outgoing links (8,074).
"List of least concern birds" is the Wikipedia page with the third highest number of outgoing links (7,897).
"List of stage names" is the Wikipedia page with the fourth highest number of outgoing links (6,637).
"List of birds of the world" is the Wikipedia page with the fifth highest number of outgoing links (6,288).
"Geographic coordinate system" is the most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,072,464 incoming links).
"International Standard Book Number" is the second most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,023,840 incoming links).
"Virtual International Authority File" is the third most linked to page on Wikipedia (517,621 incoming links).
"United States" is the fourth most linked to page on Wikipedia (476,013 incoming links).
"International Standard Name Identifier" is the fifth most linked to page on Wikipedia (406,226 incoming links).
The first Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "!!".
The last Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "ùïä".
406 Wikipedia pages (0.007% of all pages) have no incoming or outgoing links.
There are only 1,442 Wikipedia pages (0.03% of all pages) which link to no other pages.
There are 298,480 Wikipedia pages (5.21% of all pages) which are not linked to from any other page.

The "List of lists of lists" page is a list of pages that are lists of list pages on the English Wikipedia.

The "Names of large numbers" page contains words like "googol" (10^100) and "millinillion" (10^3003).
